rdf:Description.ns1:label: Rosa rubiginosa
rdf:Description.ns1:abstract: Rosa rubiginosa (sweet briar, sweetbriar rose, sweet brier or eglantine; syn. R. eglanteria) is a species of rose native to Europe and western Asia.
rdf:Description.ns1:habitat:
Rosa rubiginosa is native to most of Europe with the exception of the extreme north (above 61°N ), where it inhabits pastures and thorny bushes from the montane to the subalpine floor, with a sunny, continental climate. It is somewhat rare, with isolated specimens near roads and pastures frequented by cattle. Its presence is doubtful in western Asia. In Southern Europe it lives in higher altitudes, usually 1,000 to 1,700 m (3,300 to 5,600 ft).
In Portugal it is classified as Critically Endangered and is restricted to the Serra da Estrela range.
Rosa rubiginosa 61°N montane subalpine Southern Europe
Portugal Critically Endangered Serra da Estrela
